repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority Infrastructure
            Investment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Da Nang Priority
            Infrastructure Investment Project for Vietnam were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: an integrated
            multi-sectoral approach is the way forward despite design
            and implementation challenges. Project preparation should
            have included better assessments of land acquisition and
            management challenges. Sustainability and efficiency of
            investments were ensured by close cooperation with the
            Client and institutional development. Integrated bidding,
            operation and contract management assured better results and
            effectiveness. Appropriate decentralization of procurement
            decision making is important.

docna.cdata!:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority Infrastructure
            Investment Project

display_title.display_title:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority
            Infrastructure Investment Project

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority Infrastructure
            Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Da Nang Priority Infrastructure
            Development Project for Vietnam focuses on the City of
            Danang, capital of the central region, with the following
            development objectives : improve the living conditions and
            productivity of low income residents; b) promote economic
            growth, through strategic investments that enhance mobility
            and increase private sector participation; and c) improve
            city and district level management, through institutional
            development, human resource development and capacity
            building. The objective of the EA report is to assess
            potential environmental impacts of project activities
            proposed in Phase 1, and recommend mitigation measures to
            address such impacts. Appropriate mitigation measure are
            identified as follows : construction wastes will be quickly
            transported out of the site; streets and roads should be
            regularly sprinkled with water to reduce dust pollution;
            only low noise vehicle and equipment will used and complied
            with their established maintenance schedules; construction
            materials should be covered with canvas while being
            transported by trucks; a temporary alternative water supply
            plan during construction should be prepared; local
            authorities and local population will be kept informed of
            construction schedule; during excavation and dredging
            activities comply with environmental best practices;
            temporary sediment storage will be covered by canvas; proper
            attention should be given to ensure labor safety; and
            finally, throughout project design and implementation adhere
            to the legal and regulatory environmental and social
            provisions included in Vietnam's legislation, and
            compliance with the Bank's environmental safeguard (OP
            4.01, natural habitats (OP4.04), cultural resources (OP
            4.11) and resettlement of project affected peoples (OP 4.12)
            operational directives.

            summery - phase two

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority Infrastructure
            Development Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Danang Priority Infrastructure
            Investment Project (Danang PIIP) is a multi-sectoral project
            including four key components as follows: infrastructure for
            poverty alleviation; infrastructure for environmental
            improvement; roads; and capacity strengthening. Due to the
            nature of the project, a compensation entitlement policy
            consists of the following: A total of 48 households are
            affected due to the loss of agricultural land, of these
            there is not any displacement households (DHs) that have
            permanent land use rights for the affected land. All DHs
            will be entitled to compensation at 60% of replacement cost.
            Of the affected households 576 have permanent land use
            rights and permits for the land. These displaced persons
            (DPs) will be entitled to compensation at 100% of
            replacement cost. A total of 628 DHs are affected by the
            loss of structures, partially or severely. Of these, 392 DHs
            are affected by only partial loss of their structures.
            Remaining structures are viable for continued use. All the
            DHs regardless of the legal status of the structures will be
            entitled to compensation for affected part at replacement
            cost plus repair allowance for rehabilitation of their
            remaining structures. For rent dwelling houses in the
            resettlement areas in cases where there are no resettlement
            houses to be arranged for them at land recovery time, there
            will be arranged temporary resettlement or received a
            support of 500.000 VND/HH for 9 months (6 months to rent
            house and 3 months to construct house after receiving
            resettlement land). Out of the total of 628 affected houses,
            48 houses also have small shops in front. 44 DHs of these
            will be affected partially due to the project. These DPs
            will also be entitled to compensation for loss of incomes
            for only the transition period. 166 DPs are affected by the
            loss trees. All these DPs will be entitled to cash
            compensation for affected trees at market price.

display_title.display_title:
Vietnam - Da Nang Priority
            Infrastructure Development Project : resettlement action
            plan (Vol. 4) : Resettlement plan report : phase 2B
